page.title: 07 Darnet Fort.
page.content: Darnet fort 807707 is one of two guarding the narrow entry to Gillingham Reach of the river Medway.It is situated on the tip of Darnet Ness one of the islands which at high tide form the Nore marsh. Dating from the nineteenth century it was in use from 1872 until the 1900s. The fort is round with two floors, the upper is an open platform while the lower has a series of gunports.Today the fort is a popular picnicing spot with the many boating enthusiasts which the broad Medway estuary attracts. South of the island is an anchorage sheltered from the easterly breezes which frequently in summer give good sailing. The area being out of the fierce tidal race of of the main channel has safe bathing for children with shallow water at all states of the tide.
